intro: Jamesonia bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá Jamesonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in cool, shaded environments. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or white and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Jamesonia bogotensis is considered a vulnerable species.
